org.mocksy.filter
Class XslFilter

java.lang.Object
  org.mocksy.filter.XslFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResponseFilter
public class XslFilter
extends Object
implements ResponseFilter

ResponseFilter that uses a XSL transformation to modify the Response data.

Author:
Saleem Shafi

Create the filter with the given File as the XSL stylesheet.

XslFilter

public XslFilter(String xslTemplate)
          throws TransformerConfigurationException,
                 TransformerFactoryConfigurationError
Create the filter with the given String as the XSL stylesheet. Note: the String is NOT the name of the file containing the XSL stylesheet, but the actual XSL, itself.

Parameters:
xslTemplate - the XSL template (not the filename)
Throws:
TransformerConfigurationException
TransformerFactoryConfigurationError
Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(Map<String,String> properties)
                throws FilterException
Initializes the XslFilter. The given Map of properties must contain a "stylesheet" key whose value is a relative location to an XSL file. The file will be discovered relative to the Source object set with setRelativeSource(Source), which will probably be the location of the containing Ruleset.

Specified by:
initialize in interface ResponseFilter
Parameters:
properties - the Map containing the "stylesheet" key
Throws:
FilterException - if the XSL stylesheet couldn't be found or couldn't be processed properly.

setRelativeSource

public void setRelativeSource(Source relativeSource)
Sets the Source relative to whice the stylesheet will be found.

Specified by:
setRelativeSource in interface ResponseFilter
Parameters:
relativeSource - Source object relative to which we'll look for the stylesheet.

getProperties

public Map<String,String> getProperties()
Description copied from interface: ResponseFilter
Returns the properties used to process this filter. This will usually be the same as the ones passed into the ResponseFilter.initialize(Map) method, however, the ResponseFilter implementation might want to modify these.

Specified by:
getProperties in interface ResponseFilter
Returns:
the properties used by this filter

filter

public InputStream filter(InputStream input)
                   throws FilterException
Transforms the XML document in the InputStream using the XSL stylesheet in this filter.

Specified by:
filter in interface ResponseFilter
Parameters:
input - the InputStream containing the XML document to be transformed.
Returns:
InputStream containing the transformed document
Throws:
FilterException - if the InputStream doesn't contain a valid XML document or if there's a problem during the transformation.
